instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
hi all,

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in no chime fans did spin.
after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> (1 time i used the "new cap" with the 2 ground pads/ and 1 time the old way the 330 with a ground wire)
now it boots (chime and then os)
but after like 3/4 times turn of and on again, it gives fan spin but no more chime.
then start again and random wil boot to os or only give fan spin.

ASD gives only 1 error " No smart attributes to check"

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: Could be anything, seems like a rabbit hole to me. I assume you ruled out a bad RAM slot.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: was indeed swapping out ram slots as we speak just because i got 3 beeps at 1 time while testing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: mark as solved please, 1 ram bay dead.or deing atleast rest is good now 20 reboots no issues

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: If it is the bottom one (closest to keyboard) it is more likely to be the slot.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: yes sorry, indeed the slot near the keyboard.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message: Probably the slot is crappy. That is the BGA slot and tends to have cracked balls/traces. I wouldn't risk it and max out the first slot.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in doing nothing, replaced <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
yea just told the customer that the first slot is not useable anymore. he is okey with it.

so Main issue not booting and replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> did solve the issue.
thank again for the help.
mark as SOLVED
